titleStmt.title: The Silk Road Project: Reuniting Turfan's Scattered Treasures
titleStmt.author: Rong Xinjiang
Deng Xiaonan
Wu Jianguo
Zhang Guangda
Valerie Hansen

encodingDesc.editorialDecl: Converted into TEI XML by Sam van Schaik on 22/03/07. Imported to 4D on DATE by PERSON.

head.p: "The Silk Road Project: Reuniting Turfan's Scattered Treasures" was a three-year project funded by the Henry Luce Foundation Inc. that brought together a team of twenty-five Chinese and American scholars working within the disciplines of archeology, history, art history, and religious studies.

During the second year of the project (1997) four Chinese scholars (Deng Xiaonan, Rong Xinjiang, Wu Jianguo, and Zhang Guangda) compiled a Chinese-English database (using Microsoft Access 1997 and Twin Bridges software for Chinese) for the most important published materials from Turfan. The indexed materials concentrate on Chinese-language publications: they include the site reports of Huang Wenbi, the ten-volume set of documents Tulufan chutu wenshu (also available in four volumes with plates of the documents), the documents described in Klimkeit's Gnosis on the Silk Road (), the Kodansha/Wenwu joint publication of the Xinjiang Museum's holdings, and the brief archeological site reports published since 1949. The database is available at the project'swebsite.
An XML export of the database was kindly provided to IDP and converted into the XML format used by IDP in 2007.

msItem.title: Jianxi poem, from <<The Book of Songs>> with commentary by Mao Chang 毛 萇 。 毛 詩 簡 兮

note.p: Date: 7-9th century 七 至 九 世 紀
Languages: Chinese 漢 語
Photographs of original: 黃 文 弼 Huang Wenbi 1954 圖 版 tuban 1 圖 tu 1； 史 樹 青 Shi Shuqing 1994:86.
Transcription: 黃 文 弼 Huang Wenbi 1954:17； 史 樹 青 Shi Shuqing 1994:200
Described in: 黃 文 弼 Huang Wenbi 1954， 18-19； 史 樹 青 Shi Shuqing 1994， 2008
Comments: Found at Yarkhoto 出 交 河 故 城 。 Karlgren 1950:24-25 provides transcription and translation of this poem in the transmitted text of <<The Book of Songs>>.《 詩 經 》 有 英 譯 本 ， 見 高 本 漢 。

Last modified by: 3/10/97 Zhang Guangda張 廣 達 ， Deng Xiaonan 鄧 小 南 ， Valerie Hansen韓 森

msItem.title: Zhi character on the bottom of the sole 鞋 底 騭 文

note.p: Date: 西 涼 建 初 十 四 年 (418)前
Languages: Chinese,漢 語
Photographs of original: Tulufan chutu wenshu photos 吐 魯 番 出 土 文 書 圖 版 本 1﹕ 10
Transcription: Tulufan chutu wenshu texts 吐 魯 番 出 土 文 書 錄 文 本 1﹕ 29

Comments: Written on the exterior of the paper shoe in blue. The character zhi has several meanings, including "to ascend to heaven," and "to be at peace," suggesting this may have religious significance. to do Xiaonan translate. 紙 鞋 外 底 藍 色 書 寫 Written on the exterior of the paper shoe in blue. The character zhi has several meanings, including "to ascend to heaven," and "to be at peace," suggesting this may have religious significance. 藍 色 書 寫 于 紙 鞋 外 底 ， “ 騭 ” 字 有 不 同 含 義 ， 包 括 “ 昇 天 ” 、 “ 太 平 ” 等 等 ， 可 能 有 宗 教 意 義 。
ID number: 63TAM1﹕ 13(a)
Originally compiled by: Deng Xiaonan 鄧 小 南 Zhang Guangda 張 廣 達 Valerie Hansen 韓 森
Keywords: Bottom of the sole, the character zhi 鞋 底 ， 騭

msItem.title: Tomb inventory for Woman Zhai, wife of Song Pan, dated to the Longxing reign 龍 興 某 年 宋 泮 妻 翟 氏 隨 葬 衣 物 疏

note.p: Date: The dating of the Longxing reign has not yet been established, but should be in the first half of the fifth century 龍 興 年 號 待 考 ， 應 在 公 元 五 世 紀 前 期
Languages: Chinese,漢 語
Photographs of original: Tulufan chutu wenshu photos 吐 魯 番 出 土 文 書 圖 版 本 1﹕ 29
Transcription: Tulufan chutu wenshu texts 吐 魯 番 出 土 文 書 錄 文 本 1﹕ 61

Comments: This tomb contains documents spanning 423 to 432. Song Pan's other wife, Wei Yirong was buried in 425, suggesting the date of the Longxing reign period, when Woman Zhai was buried, should be in the early fifth century. 本 墓 出 土 有 紀 年 文 書 起 北 涼 玄 始 十 二 年 （ 423） ， 止 北 涼 義 和 二 年 （ 432） ； 宋 泮 妻 隗 儀 容 葬 于 真 興 七 年 （ 425） ， 據 此 ， 翟 氏 入 葬 之 龍 興 年 ， 應 在 公 元 五 世 紀 前 期 。
Cross reference: Meng Xianshi 孟 憲 實 1990:197--200
ID number: 75TKM96﹕ 15， 16
Originally compiled by: Deng Xiaonan 鄧 小 南 Zhang Guangda 張 廣 達 Valerie Hansen 韓 森
Keywords: Tomb inventory， Song Pan， Woman Zhai 衣 物 疏 ， 宋 泮 ， 翟 氏

Comments: This document has writing on the other side because two copies of the contract were made on one sheet. After the two were torn apart, the two characters "hetong" ("contract") were written on the seam. This contract retains the left side of the two characters. 本 件 另 面 有 點 劃 標 記 ， 當 是 一 式 兩 份 契 紙 ， 對 折 後 于 折 縫 處 所 寫 " 合 同 " 文 記 ， 本 件 所 存 為 二 字 左 半 。

Comments: For the more probable reading of Huyadagmān instead of Huwiidagmān, see MacKenzie 1985:421-428. Huwiidagmān更 可 能 的 讀 法 是 Huyadagmān， 見 麥 肯 齊 1985﹕ 421-428
Cross reference: The Chinese text 下 部 讚 Xiabuzan (Hymns Part II ?) is an expanded translation of this text. Stein number to do; M260, M 259c, M 529, P3049
ID number: M93
Originally compiled by:
Keywords: Manichaeism, hymn 摩 尼 教 ， 頌 讚

msItem.title: Hymns Part II) 下 部 讚 Xiabuzan

note.p: Languages: Chinese
Photographs of original: to do: Sichuan renmin chubanshe edition
Transcription: verses 1-5, 1270b lines 24-29, verses 154-158 1274a lines 4-9, verses 176-183, 1274b lines 12-23
Translation: Tsui Chi (English) and Schmidt-Glinzer (German)

Comments: The Chinese text S.2659 found at Dunhuang is related to the Manichean hymns, Huyadagmān and Angād Rooshnān, but the exact relationship is still not understood. In certain hymns, two lines of Parthian correspond to four lines of Chinese. The Chinese text uses a new character yu * 預 (to do: add missing stroke) instead of the standard yu 豫 , indicating avoidance of the character yu, which was the Emperor Daizong's first name. This avoidance of a taboo character allows dating of the Chinese text to his reign, 762-779. 漢 文 文 書 S.2659《 下 部 讚 》 與 摩 尼 教 讚 頌 Huyadagmān和 Angād Roosnān 有 關 ， 但 其 確 切 關 係 尚 不 能 完 全 肯 定 。 在 某 些 讚 頌 中 ， 安 息 文 兩 行 相 當 漢 文 四 行 。 漢 文 使 用 新 字 * 以 避 代 宗 名 諱 “ 豫 ” 。 此 避 諱 字 可 使 本 文 書 斷 代 在 代 宗 朝 ， 762--779。
Cross reference: M260, M 259c, M 529, P3049, M93
ID number: S2659
Originally compiled by:
Keywords: Manichaeism, hymn cycle

msItem.title: Painting of a heavenly king 天 王 圖

note.p: Languages: Chinese 漢 語 , Uighur 回 鶻 文
Photographs of original: Tulufan Diqu Wenguansuo 吐 魯 番 地 區 文 管 所 1985b:50
Transcription: Tulufan Diqu Wenguansuo 吐 魯 番 地 區 文 管 所 1985b:51
Translation: "This is Asura" 此 是 阿 修 羅
Described in: Tulufan Diqu Wenguansuo 吐 魯 番 地 區 文 管 所 1985b:50--51
Material description: mural painting 壁 畫

Comments: Four heavenly/guardian kings are painted on 4 corners of ceiling. 室 內 頂 部 四 角 凹 入 處 繪 四 大 天 王 像 。 . At center of main wall is remains of lotus shaped mandorla h. 高 2.5, w. . 寬 2.25 m . 米 . Lower left corner has painted lohan image and inscription in Chinese: "This is Asura." 正 壁 中 間 有 一 蓮 瓣 形 大 背 光 。 左 下 方 繪 有 阿 修 羅 ， 漢 文 題 記 , 此 是 阿 修 羅 。 On southern wall, lower, there are remains of more than10 different individual Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, unreadable inscription. 南 壁 下 半 部 有 十 幾 幅 各 自 獨 立 的 單 身 佛 ， 菩 薩 像 ， 漢 文 題 記 不 清 楚 。 Upper left corner of north wall has painting of 3 skeletons and inscriptions in Chinese characters: This is "Fakong," This is "Renkong." 北 壁 左 上 方 繪 三 幅 骷 髏 兩 條 漢 文 題 ， 此 是 法 空 ， 此 是 人 空 。 Inside cOn walls to either side of the door on eastern wall there are 3 registers of 4 Uighur donors and inscription in Uighur nearby, female donors on north, male donors on south of doorway. 東 壁 北 側 全 是 婦 女 ， 南 側 全 為 男 子 ， 有 回 鶻 文 題 。
ID number: Bezeklik 伯 孜 克 里 克 Cave 第 76窟
Originally compiled by: Wu Jianguo 武 建 國 , Katherine P. Lee 李 佩 璞 and Elizabeth Owen 歐 麗 文

msItem.title: Head of Buddha 佛像頭

note.p: Date: Qushi period at Gaochang, 502-640 麴氏高昌
Described in: Xinjiang shoujie kaogu zhuanye renyuan xunlian ban 新疆首屆考古專業人員訓練班 1989:11
Material description: Clay 泥質
Physical description: Remaining h. 殘高 25, w. 寬 28 cm.

Comments: Excavated in Jiaohe temple. 交河寺院發現。 Open eyes, bare chested, hands in meditation mudra, seated, robe painted red and green, facial features and hair painted black, painted mandorla with 2 Buddhas flanking umbrella shaped cloud .長目， 袒胸， 雙手定印握腹前， 盤腿而坐，衣著紅色綠色， 黑髮髻， 黑線勾勒眉目，彩繪頭部圓光， 畫面有兩佛， 之間有蓮花似的傘狀云。
Originally compiled by: Elizabeth Owen 歐麗文 and Katherine Lee李佩璞
Keywords: Jiaohe, temple, Buddhism, Buddha, head 佛教， 佛陀， 頭， 交河， 寺院，

msItem.title: Temple plan 寺院平面圖

note.p: Date: Qushi period at Gaochang, 502-640 麴氏高昌
Photographs of original: Xinjiang shoujie kaogu zhuanye renyuan xunlian ban 新疆首屆考古專業人員訓練班 1989:11
Described in: Xinjiang shoujie kaogu zhuanye renyuan xunlian ban 新疆首屆考古專業人員訓練班 1989:10-11
Physical description: Main hall 正殿 l. 長 7.75, w. 寬 7.2 m.

Comments: Located on west cliff of Jiaohe, pounded earth walls, total 25 rooms, main hall in south center with platforms to the north and south and bench in center. Ash pit under north platform probably for incense burning. Row of rooms surrounding main hall. In rubble 200 plus objects excavated: Buddha head, copper coins, pottery, wooden tool, cotton textile. 位于交河古城西面崖邊高坡上， 由二十五間房組成， 正殿在寺院中央偏南, 南北各置台階， 中央有須彌坐，北面台下有一灰坑可能為燒香火之用。寺院底禰捅壑 . 寺院周圍黃土� 牆。 堆積 中發現文物200餘件﹕ 佛像頭， 銅錢， 陶器， 木器， 棉織品。
Originally compiled by: Elizabeth Owen 歐麗文 and Katherine Lee李佩璞
Keywords: Jiaohe, Buddhism, Buddha, coins, money, pottery, wood, tool, cotton, textile, temple, architecture, sketch, plan, diagram, map 寺院， 建築， 平面圖， 草圖， 地圖， 交河， 佛教， 佛陀， 銅錢， 陶器， 木器， 絲織品， 紡織品， 棉織品

msItem.title: Mural painting of scenes from daily life of tomb occupant 墓主生前的莊園生活情景

note.p: Date: Northern Liang 北涼 (401-439)
Described in: Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館 1978: 7
Material description: mural painting 壁畫

Comments: 5 segments 五個畫面. Left to right : 從左到右. 1. grain thrasher 舂臼 and alms bowl 缽, 2. field outlined in black in upper half 黑線描的田地在上半部， curved tree branch in lower half 彎曲的樹枝在下半部, 3. seated male tomb occupant wearing long, wide-sleeved robe and holding fan 席地而坐的墓主， 穿闊袖長袍手持團扇, Behind stands one female attendant with two bun hairstyle and holding long stick 墓主身後站立一女侍 頭梳雙髻， 手持一長棍。 4. Upper left, short table with pottery basin and ladle, 2 vessels on top 左上部 為矮几， 上置陶盆， 柄勺，另置二個器皿. Lower half 下半部 has one servant behind a stove with pottery basin with ladle 有一仆人前有三腳爐灶上有一陶盆， 柄勺。 Upper right corner 右上角有一個推磨。
ID number: 75TKM96
Originally compiled by: Elizabeth Owen 歐麗文 and Katherine Lee李佩璞
Keywords: Mural, painting, tomb occupant, tomb, 壁畫， 繪畫， 墳墓， 墓主

msItem.title: Mural painting of scenes from daily life 莊園生活情景

note.p: Date: Northern Liang 北涼 (401-439)
Described in: Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館 1978: 7
Material description: mural painting 壁畫

Comments: 6 sections, left to right 六個畫面， 從左到右。 1. Servant with hand in pottery bowl behind three footed stove 仆人手伸向陶盆內前面是三腳爐灶。 2. Bow with arrow in quiver 一副弓箭， 箭在箭襄。 3. Seated male tomb occupant and one female both wearing long wide sleeved robes 一男一女各穿闊袖長袍， 應是主人。 男席地而坐。 Bow and arrow in quiver hang from wall, table with brush and pottery bowl牆上掛有弓箭， 箭在襄內。 一張小桌， 上有一支筆杆一個陶盂。 4. Person wearing short sleeves, long pants tucked in boots, high hat, probably minority, leading horse followed by camel 一人牽馬， 人穿短袖長褲， 褲腿塞在靴統內， 頭帶高頂帽，為一少數民族形象。 馬后有一匹駱駝。 5. Upper half has 3 fruit trees, lower half has one ox pulling a cart 上半部有三棵果樹， 下半部一牛拉著車。 6. Five black lines forming field 五條黑線表示田地。 Sun and half moon frame scenes 1, 2, 3 太陽半圓形的月亮在第1， 2， 3 畫面的上部。
ID number: 75TKM97
Originally compiled by: Elizabeth Owen 歐麗文 and Katherine Lee李佩璞
Keywords: Mural, painting, tomb, 壁畫， 繪畫， 墳墓，

Described in: Xinjiang bowuguan 新疆博物館 1973a: 19
Material description: mural painting 壁畫

Comments: Located on ceiling and upper four walls of main chamber. Includes: twenty-eight constellations, sun with gold bird in northeast, moon with cassia tree and jade rabbit holding pastal, and crescent moon in southwest, and milkway in center. 主室頂部及四壁上部繪28宿， 東北壁有太陽， 內有金鳥。 西南壁有月亮， 內有桂樹和持杵玉兔， 旁有殘月。 之中有銀河。

Described in: Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館1960: 15

Comments: Suggested reconstruction. All three corpses wear masks. For male corpse, covers from eyebrows to chin including cheeks, openings for eyes. 死者臉部都有复面。 想象復原圖。男尸， 蓋眉至嘴， 眼部開洞。 Bands on four corners for tying 四角有帶子以束系。

For female corpse I, covers from eyebrows to chin including cheeks, openings for eyes. 想象復原圖。 女尸， 蓋眉至嘴， 眼部開洞。 Bands on four corners for tying 四角有帶子以束系。 Purple "juan" silk with silver border decorated with 3 beads, 2 made of bone placed around eyes, 1 made of amber placed by tip of nose. 紫絹銀邊， 上綴穿珠三顆， 兩顆骨質眼部， 一顆瑪瑙質鼻尖。

Material description: "Juan" silk, hemp, "jin" brocade 絹， 麻布，錦

Comments: First layer is hemp cloth, second layer of plain silk wrapping includes head. She wears long overcoat to knees and skirt, both made of purple "juan" silk. Addorsed horse design exposed. 內裹麻布， 外以素絹連頭包裹， 上身穿齊膝外套， 下系裙， 均用茄紫色絹縫制， 胸上露出的部分縫 <對馬>>織錦.

Comments: Total 2 共二件。 Orange base with blue, white, green, red design. 橘紅地， 藍， 白， 綠， 紅色花紋。 Wrapped around round, taper waisted wooden sticks, one found on female corpse I's waist. 裹于束腰式的圓木棒上， 發現于I女尸腰部。See clothing for female corpse I in 59TAM302 見 59TAM302 女尸 I 衣服 (Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館1960: 14).
ID number: 59TAM302
Originally compiled by: Elizabeth Owen 歐麗文 and Katherine Lee 李佩璞
Keywords: Textile, "jin" brocade, floral motif, pearl border 絲織品， 紡織品， 錦， 花紋， 聯珠

note.p: Date: 653 (epitaph 墓誌)

Material description: "juan" silk 絹
Physical description: l. 長 1.78, upper w. 上寬 1.2, lower w. 下寬 0.82 m.

Comments: One wrapped in plain "juan" silk and placed before head of Female Corpse 2. 一幅用素絹包裹置于II女尸頭前。 Other 2 originally had top attached with wooden nails to tomb chamber ceiling, bottom hangs down 其它二幅，原來用木釘頂于室頂， 畫面向下張開。 Plain silk ground 素絹地。 Total 3 paintings 共三幅. F xi holds ruler and ink "cup and string" that is still used in Xinjiang today. 伏羲手中有矩， 還有一個墨斗。 Z這種墨斗在新疆各地沿用到今天。 See 見 67TAM76 in 新 疆 博 物 館 Xinjiang Bowuguan 1991: 145; 新疆博物館 Xinjiang Bowuguan 1975b: 115, 166; photo on file 耶 魯 藏 圖 片 ; 黃 文 弼 Huang Wenbi 1954 圖 版 tuban 59 圖 tu 61; 86TAM386 in Tulufan Diqu Wenguansuo 吐 魯 番 地 區 文 管 所 1992:154; [Wenwu 04266] photo on file 耶 魯 藏 圖 片 ; Tulufan diqu wenwu baoguansuo 吐魯番地區文物保管所 1994: 77 for 79TAM383: 5; 59TAM302 in Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館1960: 2:4; 59TAM303 in Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館1960: 17; 59TAM301 in Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館1960: 17; 67TAM77 and 66TAM43 in Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館 1972a: 23 and 66TAM48 in Xinjiang Bowuguan 新疆博物館 1972a: 12.
